Show Password Sign In Forgot Password Login Instruction First Login Instructions Please enter your member number into the MEMBER NUMBER (username) field. For example, if your membership number is 12345, you will type 12345 in the "MEMBER NUMBER" box on the login screen. Your temporary password will be your last name lowercase. After you click "SIGN IN" you will be taken to a new screen where you will be required to update your temporary password to a secure password of your choosing. If you are the spouse of the primary member, please add ‚Äò-S' after your member number as your login. (Ex:12345-S) Forgot Your Password? Have your member number ready. Click the Forgot Password link and enter your member number. You will receive an email with your password. If you would like additional assistance, please contact Us. 11501 El Clair Ranch Rd. Boynton Beach, FL 33437 561.737.5544 [email¬†protected] 4476 Fountains Drive Lake Worth, Florida 33467 561.642.2700 [email¬†protected] Privacy Policy Copyright ¬© Indian Springs CC & Fountains CC. Thank you for your interest in Indian Spring Country Club. We offer a friendly, fast-paced professional environment where employees are developed for success. We have a full range of employment opportunities in a variety of fields at this prestigious Club. Many times we have opportunities available in food and beverage, maintenance, housekeeping, and landscaping. We are always accepting applications from qualified individuals that take pride in their work, love what they do, and look forward to being part of a great team. For more information about our open positions, please click on the link below. VIEW INDIAN SPRING & FOUNTAINS ON BETTERTEAM Indian Spring Country Club & Fountains Country Club are Equal Opportunity Employers. This company does not and will not discriminate in employment and personnel practices on the basis of race, sex, age, handicap, religion, national origin or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Hiring, transferring and promotion practices are performed without regard to the above-listed terms. 11501 El Clair Ranch Rd. April's Showers & May's Flowers: Your Step-by-Step Guide to Planning Your Dream Wedding! - Indian Springs CC & Fountains CC Please ensure Javascript is enabled for purposes of website accessibility April's Showers & May's Flowers: Your Step-by-Step Guide to Planning Your Dream Wedding! Navigation Skip to Content Loading Member Login Drop Down Navigation Close Home About Contact Us Real Estate Affiliated Clubs Charity of Choice Careers Membership Plan an Event at ISCC Weddings Meetings and Special Events Golf Outings Blog Plan an Event at FCC Weddings Meetings and Special Events Golf Outings Blogs Golf Golf Experience Indian Spring Course Tour Fountains Course Tour Dining and Social Events Tennis and Pickleball Pool Menu HTML Generator Our Blog Our Blog Our blog is full of ideas for your events, fun facts, and more. We encourage you to read through each post at your leisure and contact our Catering Director to begin planning your next event. null Blogs April's Showers & May's Flowers: Your Step-by-Step Guide to Planning Your Dream Wedding! Nadia Sharp Published Date 1 Year Ago As April‚Äôs showers give way to May‚Äôs flowers, the season of love is in full bloom, making it the perfect time to plan your dream wedding. If you‚Äôve ever dreamed of a timeless and elegant affair, a country club wedding could be just the ticket. With sprawling landscapes, refined amenities, and impeccable service, country clubs offer a picturesque backdrop for your special day. In this step-by-step guide, we‚Äôll walk you through the process of planning your country club wedding, from selecting the perfect venue to saying ‚ÄúI do‚Äù in style. STEP 1: CHOOSE YOUR VENUE The first step in planning your country club wedding is to choose the perfect venue. Start by researching out to our Catering team and schedule tour to visit our beautiful country club. Consider factors such as the size of the club, the layout of the grounds, and the available amenities, such as indoor and outdoor ceremony spaces, banquet halls, and bridal suites. Don‚Äôt forget to inquire about pricing and any exclusive services offered by our country club to make your wedding truly unforgettable. STEP 2: SET A DATE & BUDGET It‚Äôs time to set a date and establish a budget for your wedding. Consider factors such as the season, availability of the club, and any special dates that hold significance for you and your partner. Work with the clubs Sales Director to determine pricing options that fit within your budget while still allowing you to create the wedding of your dreams. STEP 3: CUSTOMIZE YOUR WEDDING Work closely with the venue‚Äôs event coordinator to choose the perfect combination of services, from catering and bar options to decor and entertainment. Whether you envision a formal sit-down dinner or a casual buffet-style reception, our experienced staff at the club will work with you to bring your vision to life. STEP 4: SELECT YOUR VENDORS With the major details of your wedding package in place, it‚Äôs time to assemble your team of vendors to help bring your vision to life. Start by booking essential services such as a photographer, florist, and entertainment. Consider preferred vendors who have experience working with the country club venue to ensure a seamless and stress-free experience on your wedding day. Don‚Äôt forget to read reviews, ask for recommendations, and schedule meetings or consultations to ensure that you feel confident in your choices. STEP 5: ATTEND TO THE DETAILS As the big day approaches, it‚Äôs time to attend to the countless details that will make your country club wedding truly unforgettable. Finalize your guest list and RSVPs, create a timeline for the day‚Äôs events, and confirm arrangements with all of your vendors. Consider additional touches such as personalized signage, wedding favors, and decorative accents to add a personal touch to your celebration. Most importantly, take time to relax and enjoy this special time with your partner, knowing that your country club wedding is sure to be a day to remember. Planning a country club wedding is an exciting and rewarding experience, filled with endless possibilities for creating the wedding of your dreams. From selecting the perfect venue to customizing your wedding and attending to the smallest details, each step of the journey brings you closer to the wedding day you‚Äôve always imagined. So, embrace the beauty of April‚Äôs showers and May‚Äôs flowers and let the elegance and charm of a country club wedding set the stage for a lifetime of love and happiness. Cheers to a day filled with joy, laughter, and cherished memories that will last a lifetime! planning wedding 11501 El Clair Ranch Rd. What property are you interested in? Questions/Comments Join Newsletter Join our email newsletter to receive the latest news and updates. Close Let's Talk Leadership Careers Concert Cares Privacy Policy Boynton Beach, FL Indian Spring Country Club Indian Spring Country Club is a leading 36-hole formerly member-owned private club in the relaxed seaside town of Boynton Beach, Florida. The club features two championship golf courses, 26 Har-Tru‚Ñ¢ tennis courts, a modern 52,000-square-foot Clubhouse with a 450-person dining room, a state-of-the-art spa and a fitness center. Contact 11501 El Clair Ranch Road Boynton Beach, FL 33437 (561) 737-5544 membership@indianspringcc.com Links View Website Download Press Release Indian Spring Country Club‚Äôs Partnership with Concert Golf Indian Spring Country Club in Boynton Beach faced a common problem for club housing communities: residents were aging, club membership was dwindling, but maintenance costs and debt payments remained ongoing. Some communities, such as the Fountains Country Club near Lake Worth, the President Country Club in West Palm Beach, and Polo Trace near Delray Beach, recently have courted real estate developers willing to buy some or all of their golf courses, as a solution to their club money problems. But sometimes clubs make deals at the 11th hour with little leverage. In other cases, members spend years fighting among themselves over whether to sell their club or its golf course ‚Äî or hold out for a miracle that can preserve the status quo. At Indian Spring, the club‚Äôs leaders and its members did something different. They decided to be proactive. In 2017, club members voted 221-2 to sell the country club for an undisclosed price to Concert Golf Partners. It‚Äôs a satisfying end to a long-troubling problem, and Indian Spring resident and former club president Bill Aronson, who for years has wanted a long-term club plan, is proud of the result. Explore Case Studies Elevate Your Club‚Äôs Future with Concert Golf Partners Raise your club‚Äôs overall experience by injecting capital into new amenities and restoring existing facilities. To start your recapitalization journey, contact us today. Say ‚ÄúI do!‚Äù under swaying palm trees in front of the gazebo, enjoy cocktail hour in the indoor-outdoor lounge, and dance the night away at your reception inside of the show-stopping Grand Ballroom. Gorgeous views of the courses and water features are abundant in almost all locations, natural lighting blankets every corner of our property, and hospitable staff await you and your guests around every corner. Whether you are hosting an intimate elopement for 25 guests or an extravagant soir√©e of 400 guests, our professional event staff will be there to help you plan every detail. The Indian Spring Country Club wedding packages include everything you need for hosting: catering, bar packages, tables, silver Chiavari chairs, linens, dinnerware, utensils, and more! Contact our Catering Director to peruse our wedding packages guide and enjoy a complimentary wedding consultation today! Consider us for your... Concert Golf Partners Has Invested Over $4 Million of Capital Improvements into South Florida‚Äôs Indian Spring C.C. and Fountains C.C. | Concert Golf Partners Skip to main content Concert Golf Partners (Go to home) Toggle Menu What We Do Toggle sub menu Back Why Concert Golf Leadership Concert Cares Testimonials FAQs Vendors Careers Club Success Toggle sub menu Back Case Studies Signs Your Club May Want To Recapitalize Maintaining Club Culture Club Members Our Clubs Solutions Toggle sub menu Back Golf Management Financing Capital Improvements Club Consulting News & Education Contact Back Let‚Äôs Talk " * " indicates required fields Send Us A Note About Your Club First Name * Last Name * Email * Phone Reason for Inquiry * Member Relations Careers New Membership Inquiry Strategic Planning & Club Partnerships Vendor Relations Private Events Where would you like to hold your event? Close Let's Talk Leadership Careers Concert Cares Privacy Policy Concert Golf Partners Has Invested Over $4 Million of Capital Improvements into South Florida‚Äôs Indian Spring C.C. and Fountains C.C. < Back Concert Golf Partners Has Invested Over $4 Million of Capital Improvements into South Florida‚Äôs Indian Spring C.C. and Fountains C.C. Dual Memberships provide special access into two of the most amenitized private clubs in the area for the next generation of residents and non-residents alike Exciting, fun vibe that features 54 holes of championship golf, the Fountains Sports Complex, Pickleball, Tennis, Fitness and much more available for both families and active resort lifestyles WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. and LAKE MARY, Fla. (Feb. 19, 2024) ‚Äì Emphasizing a fun, fit and creatively dynamic South Florida vibe, Concert Golf Partners has invested more than a combined $4 million of strategic capital into Indian Spring Country Club in Boynton Beach, Florida, and its sister club, Fountains Country Club, in nearby Lake Worth Beach. Concert Golf Partners, headquartered near Orlando in Lake Mary, is a boutique club hospitality company that invests its own capital to fund projects, build new amenities, pay off all club debt and ensure that member assessments are a thing of the past through a recapitalization program that Concert pioneered. With decades of experience owning and operating private clubs, Concert‚Äôs expertise lies in providing exceptional member experiences and building vibrant club communities. Concert offers coordinated expansion efforts with seamless transitions, relieving owners and board members of the stress and financial burden a third-party club management company would impose. The acquisitions by Concert of both Indian Spring in 2017 and Fountains in 2018 have helped spur increases in home values in the surrounding area. Uncertainty about the future of the clubs was alleviated, as Concert paid off all outstanding debt and injected substantial capital improvements. In just the past six months alone, Concert Golf has driven $640,000 of innovative upgrades to these two iconic Palm Beach County facilities to further make them the most amenitized private clubs in the area. A well-maintained, well-funded country club in a neighborhood is better for a community member‚Äôs largest financial investment, their home, as opposed to member-owned clubs that might struggle to pass assessments or stick to a business plan for decades with a revolving board of members with differing agendas. The result is a special opportunity for the next generation of members to enjoy the two clubs‚Äîlocated just eight miles apart‚Äîwhich uniquely appeal to both families and retirees alike through a dual membership that provides special access to both clubs and an incredible lifestyle dedicated to recreation, family, fitness, entertainment and more. It‚Äôs all part of the Concert personal touch. One of Palm Beach County‚Äôs premier private clubs, Indian Spring C.C. is visually stunning but it also offers amenities that every golfer wants, highlighted by a state-of-the-art, short game practice facility with PGA Professional instruction and dual-sided driving range. The club is renowned for its active resort lifestyle, set within a beautiful surrounding residential neighborhood that is meticulously maintained. Nestled in this picturesque South Florida landscape are two championship golf courses designed by Kipp Schulties, along with a modern, 52,000-sq. ft. clubhouse that features a 450-person dining room, entertainment and a newly designed fitness center. Indian Spring is dedicated solely to the preservation of a relaxing and enjoyable lifestyle. Just a few miles to the north along Jog Road, Fountains C.C. is located on 865 beautiful acres that was once a sprawling orange grove, with 36 holes of championship golf designed to test all aspects of your golf game by regarded golf architects Robert Van Hagge and Bruce Devlin. Through the years, Fountains has hosted the Allianz Championship, Honda Classic Pre-Qualifier Tournaments and FAU Golf Championship. The club also features superior recreation facilities, casual and fine dining, a resort-style pool and a social calendar that can cater to the entire family. Led by Director of Sports Operations David Jasmin, the separate 17,000-sq. ft. Fountains Sports Complex offers personal fitness and instruction, a sprawling tennis facility with 12 Har-Tru courts, Pickleball, a Beach Entry Pool, Fitness Center with Physical Therapy, Bocce and the Aqua Bar & Grill. With several USTA teaching pros on staff who have competed in Grand Slam tournaments, the tennis instruction and clinics are truly world-class. The onsite Junior Tennis Academies have produced¬†world-ranked players. The Sports Complex provides fun exercise opportunities for everyone, including classes in Pilates, Yoga, Zumba and more. As part of your Home Club membership, your benefits extend beyond your Club and give you ‚ÄúHome Away From Home‚Äù access to 33 Concert Golf owned and operated properties across America, including nine prestigious clubs across Florida. This enables members to explore beyond their Club when you are traveling for business or pleasure. Take in a round of golf, a tennis match, a swim or enjoy dining at private clubs nationwide. In addition, Club members have access to over 600 properties worldwide through Concert‚Äôs partnerships with The Executive Golfer and Links2Golf. All memberships to Indian Spring Country Club and Fountains Country Club include primary, spouse, and children under the age of 26. Each membership will have a one-time, non-refundable Initiation Fee and monthly dues according to their category. There are also new Reinstatement Programs designed specifically for prior members interested in rejoining the clubs, as well as entry level social memberships available. Memberships to each individual club are also available. For Membership information and pricing for Indian Spring C.C.¬†and Fountains C.C.¬†contact: Michael Padden at mpadden@concertgolfclubs.com or 561-302-6344. Visit IndianSpringCC.com and Fountainscc.com for details. About Indian Spring Country Club Indian Spring is a gated, meticulously landscaped, private membership country club community, where you can live the life you‚Äôve always dreamed about, surrounded by friends who make you feel right at home. Located in the relaxed seaside town of Boynton Beach, this lush, 800-acre community showcases unrivaled recreational and social venues, as well as two championship golf courses with rolling fairways and brush-cut greens, a state-of-the-art fitness facility, and casual and elegant dining establishments to satisfy every taste. There is also a world-class clubhouse and active social calendar, where every day brings something new. Whether it‚Äôs a round of golf, an elegant dinner dance, or an afternoon of cards, Indian Spring Country Club has something for everyone. About Fountains Country Club Fountains Country Club is a private country club established in 1972 in Palm Beach County, Florida. The Club is located on 865 beautifully landscaped acres within a prestigious and superbly maintained gated golf community in Lake Worth, with its championship golf course designed by world renowned Golf Architects Robert Von Hagge and Bruce Devlin. The Fountains Sports Complex offers 12 Har-Tru surfaced courts, pickleball, bocce ball, and more for our Members to stay active. When not busy playing golf or tennis, enjoy the 8,000 square foot state-of-the-art fitness center, complete with the latest in cardio and weight equipment, massage rooms, sauna, steam room, and locker rooms. Aerobics classes, Pilates, and individual training sessions, with a staff of licensed personal trainers, are perfect for our Members looking for an active and healthy lifestyle. Lounge at our resort-style pool and enjoy lunch or happy hour at the Aqua Pool Bar & Grill. About Concert Golf Partners Concert Golf Partners is a boutique owner-operator of top private golf and country clubs. Formed in 2011 by Peter Nanula, Founder and CEO of Arnold Palmer Golf Management in the 1990s, and Co-Founder and COO, Susan Dunnavant, Concert Golf has amassed $250 million of patient, long-term equity capital to invest in private clubs. Concert Golf is unique for its track record of preserving the identity and traditions of historic clubs. Concert Golf‚Äôs boutique collection of upscale clubs now numbers 33 nationally, including both formerly developer-owned clubs, such as The Club at Longview in Charlotte, N.C. and The Club at Renaissance in Ft. Myers, Fla., as well as longtime member-owned clubs such as White Manor Country Club in Philadelphia, Pa., The Muttontown Club on Long Island, N.Y., and The Club at Pasadera in Monterey, Calif. JUST IN: How Boynton Beach‚Äôs Indian Spring safeguarded its country club News Sports Restaurants Real Estate Opinion Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals BUSINESS JUST IN: How Boynton Beach‚Äôs Indian Spring safeguarded its country club Alexandra Clough aclough@pbpost.com Indian Spring Country Club in Boynton Beach faced a common problem for club housing communities: Residents were aging, club membership was dwindling but maintenance costs and debt payments remained ongoing. Some communities, such as the Fountains Country Club near Lake Worth, the President Country Club in West Palm Beach and Polo Trace near Delray Beach, recently have courted real estate developers willing to buy some or all of their golf courses, as a solution to their club money problems. But sometimes clubs make deals at the 11th hour with little leverage. In other cases, members spend years fighting among themselves over whether to sell their club or its golf course ‚Äî or hold out for a miracle that can preserve the status quo. At Indian Spring, the club‚Äôs leaders and its members did something different. They decided to be proactive. This year, club members voted 221-2 to sell the country club for an undisclosed price to Concert Golf Partners, a Newport Beach, Calif.-based owner of boutique, private golf clubs. Concert Golf took over club operation last month. Looking for a free mini puzzle? Play the USA TODAY Quick Cross now. It‚Äôs a satisfying end to a long-troubling problem, and Indian Spring resident and former club president Bill Aronson, who for years has wanted a long-term club plan, is proud of the result. The alternative, such as selling off pieces of the golf courses like other communities, was a non-starter. ‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt solve all the problems,‚Äù Aronson said. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre just putting off the inevitable for some cash. In a couple of years, you‚Äôll still have the same issue.‚Äù Indian Spring is a 1,900-home community on Woolbright Road at El Clair Ranch Road that features mostly single-family homes. The community, built in 1988, has two 18-hole golf courses, 26 tennis courts and a 52,000-square-foot clubhouse that can accommodate 450 diners. Like clubs scattered throughout the county, Indian Spring once had a booming business in equity club membership, particularly among residents who enjoyed playing golf. Indian Spring is an age 55-and-up community. But retirees who bought homes in the 1980s now are at or over age 90, and some are unable to play golf. Other homeowners who bought decades ago have died and a spouse still may live in the home but not play sports. Indian Spring is a non-mandatory membership, meaning residents who live in the community do not have to ‚Äúbuy in‚Äù to the club in order to live there. During the last five years, signs became clear the club‚Äôs future was uncertain. The club gained 31 equity members but lost 299 equity members, either from death, health problems or inability to pay dues, said club general manager Dennis Griffin. Equity club membership fell to 300, down from a high of more than 1,000 members. (The club also has non-equity club members, bringing total membership to 749.) Under the direction of club president Ron Schulman , Griffin said the club ‚Äúdecided not to wait until disaster hit. We still had a lot of leverage in negotiation.‚Äù Aronson said the club sifted through offers made by real estate developers and golf course operators. Members who scouted Concert Golf‚Äôs other clubs liked what they saw. Michael Padden , Concert Golf‚Äôs director of member sales, said Concert Golf was impressed with Indian Spring because the facilities are in ‚Äúfantastic‚Äù condition and the membership is down-to-earth. The golf club world ‚Äúisn‚Äôt all doom and gloom,‚Äù Padden said. ‚ÄúYou can still find the stars out there. Our intention is to run (Indian Spring) as a private club and make money doing it.‚Äù There‚Äôs still room for improvement, though, and Concert Golf intends to expand and renovate the fitness center, upgrade the reception area and upgrade outdoor dining. About $1 million in improvements are planned. Concert Golf concessions helped close the deal. The company pledged to keep the club private for 12 years, not levy assessments for equity members and drop dues for equity members by 10-15 percent over a two-year period. Concert Golf also agreed not to sell off the golf courses. ‚ÄúThey intend to maintain it is a 36-hole course,‚Äù Griffin said. Concert Golf has 15 private clubs, including four others in Florida. Concert Golf allows members of one club to play at its other clubs. So these days, Indian Spring homeowner Howard Needleman , who is spending the summer in Boston, is happy playing golf at Concert Golf‚Äôs Boston course, he said. Word of Concert Golf‚Äôs ownership quietly is spreading to nearby communities. Padden said Indian Spring has sold 40 memberships in the past 30 days alone. Golf memberships sell for about $10,000 a year. Meanwhile, other clubs in Palm Beach County struggle for a resolution. The Fountains Country Club last year struck a deal to sell parts of one of three golf courses to GL Homes for new homes, but the deal has been delayed by technical issues. In the interim, the sprawling community between Lake Worth Road to the north and Lantana Road to the south remains divided . Only residents living in The Fountain‚Äôs southern communities are required to have mandatory club membership. (Residents in northern subdivisions won a legal battle to undo mandatory membership.) In recent years, some Fountains residents have quit the club because they can‚Äôt pay the dues or are too old to play golf. But the Fountains Country Club isn‚Äôt letting them off the hook. In fact, the country club has sued numerous Fountains residents for failing to pay club dues. As a result, instead of spending money tending to the greens, the club spends money on lawyers. With membership dwindling and bad blood growing, not enough money is rolling in to maintain the club. On June 22, equity club members were notified that monthly assessments for the next seven months will jump from $120 a month to $320 a month. Also, the north golf course, one of three Fountains courses, was closed. Club President Jeff Hamburger blamed lower membership, reserve requirements by the club‚Äôs lender, Wells Fargo , and the club‚Äôs failure to reverse court decisions that allowed the northern portion of the community to opt-out of mandatory membership.
